intro: Limonium delicatulum subsp. angustebracteatum, commonly known as narrow bract sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in salty, well-drained soils. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is often found in dune habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for coastal gardens and landscapes.
